bioghist.p: The College of Physicians of Philadelphia, founded in 1787, is the oldest professional medical organization in the country. The College is home to the MÃ¼tter Museum and the Historical Medical Library. Through its program of lectures, workshops, and conferences, as well as through the C. Everett Koop Community Education Center and PhillyHealthInfo.org, an online health information resource, the College provides a place for both medical professionals and the general public to learn about medicine as both a science and as an art. The Secretary of the College of Physicians records the minutes and transactions of the College and is responsible for keeping lists of the Fellows, notifies officers and committee members of elections and appointments, and submits an annual report on the fellowship to the Council.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of records of Office of the Secretary of the College of Physicians of Philadelphia. Materials include: programs, newsletters, ballots, announcement of meetings and lectures, and some correspondence of the secretary related to meetings and programs, (1912-1981); Secretary's files related to fellowships, including questionnaires, biographical information, and printed lists and directories of Fellows (1886-1985); annual reports and correspondence (1934-1940); correspondence, 1890-1908; reports from the Office of the Secretary, 1992-1993; financial reports, 1989 and 1996; bank book, receipt book, check book, and petty cash book (1896-1908); abstract of correspondence to the CPP from 1787 to 1833, made by Henry Bond; College of Physicians calendars (1895-1941); and miscellaneous notes and correspondence (1833-1861)

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
